javadoc: The LableFieldLocation class contains specific location information within the LABEL field of a CodeUnitLocation object.

methods.javadoc:
Default constructor needed for restoring
 a label field location from XML
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Default constructor needed for restoring
 a label field location from XML

methods.name: <init>

params.name: addr
params.comment: address of the location; should not be null

params.name: componentPath
params.comment:
array of indexes for each nested data component; the
 index is the data component's index within its parent; may be null

params.name: label
params.comment: the label String at this location.

params.name: row
params.comment:
the row in list of labels as displayed by the label field.  Only used for
 program location comparison purposes.

params.name: charOffset
params.comment: the column position within the label string for this location.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a new LabelFieldLocation where the namespace is global, primary is false, and
 the cursor location is at row 0, column 0;

params.name: label
params.comment: the name of the symbol for this label location.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: addr
params.comment: address of the location; should not be null

params.name: label
params.comment: the label String at this location.

params.name: namespace
params.comment: the namespace for the label. Null will default to the global namespace.

params.name: row
params.comment:
the row in list of labels as displayed by the label field.  Only used for
 program location comparison purposes.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a label field location using the specified symbol
 and an index of 0.

params.name: s
params.comment: the symbol to use when creating the location

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a label field location using the specified symbol
 and the specified field index.

params.name: s
params.comment: the symbol to use when creating the location

params.name: charOffset
params.comment: the position within the label string for this location

methods.javadoc: Return the label string at this location.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Return the label string at this location.

methods.name: getSymbol
methods.comment:
Returns the symbol at this LabelFieldLocation
 NOTE: currently a null symbol will be returned for default thunk functions

return.comment: the symbol at this LabelFieldLocation or null if symbol lookup fails

methods.javadoc:
Returns the symbol path which corresponds to the label location
@return symbol path
methods.name: getSymbolPath
methods.comment: Returns the symbol path which corresponds to the label location

methods.javadoc: Returns a String representation of this location.
methods.name: toString
methods.comment: Returns a String representation of this location.

name: LabelFieldLocation
comment:
The LableFieldLocation class contains specific location information
 within the LABEL field of a CodeUnitLocation object.
